questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML is HyperText Markup Language, the standard for web pages.

questions.question: Which tag creates a paragraph in HTML?
questions.explanation:
The

tag defines a paragraph in HTML documents.

questions.question: Which tag creates the largest heading?
questions.explanation: <h1> creates the largest heading, with <h6> being smallest.

questions.question: What tag creates a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> anchor tag creates hyperlinks with the href attribute.

questions.question: Which attribute specifies the image source?
questions.explanation: The src attribute specifies the path to the image file.

questions.question: What tag creates an unordered list?
questions.explanation: <ul> creates unordered lists with bullet points.

questions.question: Which tag creates a line break?
questions.explanation:
The
tag inserts a line break without starting a new paragraph.

questions.question: What element contains metadata about the HTML document?
questions.explanation: The <head> element contains metadata like title and links.

questions.question: Which tag makes text bold?
questions.explanation: Both <b> and <strong> make text bold, though <strong> adds semantic meaning.

questions.question: What tag creates a table in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <table> tag creates tables with rows and columns.
